events.originalText: A massive landslide in Oso, Washington, killed 43 people after engulfing a rural neighborhood, the largest death toll for a standalone landslide in U.S. history.
events.subtitle: 2014 Oso mudslide
events.headline: Massive landslide in Oso, Washington, kills 43 people

events.originalText: Palestinian imam Sheikh Ahmed Yassin, a founder and the spiritual leader of Hamas, was killed by an Israeli missile as he left early morning prayers.
events.subtitle: Imam
events.headline: Palestinian imam Sheikh Ahmed Yassin killed by Israeli missile

events.originalText: Russian cosmonaut Valeri Polyakov returned from the space station Mir aboard Soyuz TM-20 after 437 days in space, setting a record for the longest spaceflight.
events.subtitle: Astronaut
events.headline: Russian cosmonaut Valeri Polyakov sets record for longest spaceflight

events.originalText: USAir Flight 405 crashed in Flushing Bay shortly after takeoff from New York City's LaGuardia Airport, killing 27 people, and leading to studies into the effects of ice on aircraft.
events.subtitle: USAir Flight 405
events.headline: USAir Flight 405 crashes in Flushing Bay, killing 27

events.originalText: Teachers at a preschool in Manhattan Beach, California, were falsely charged with the sexual abuse of schoolchildren, leading to the longest and costliest criminal trial in United States history.
events.subtitle: Manhattan Beach, California
events.headline: Preschool teachers falsely charged with sexual abuse in Manhattan Beach

events.originalText: Second World War: British and Italian naval forces fought the Second Battle of Sirte in the Gulf of Sidra north of Libya.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British and Italian naval forces fight Second Battle of Sirte

events.originalText: Phan Xích Long (pictured), the self-proclaimed emperor of Vietnam, was arrested for organising a revolt against the colonial rule of French Indochina, which was nevertheless carried out by his supporters the following day.
events.subtitle: Phan Xích Long
events.headline: Vietnamese self-proclaimed emperor Phan Xích Long arrested for revolt

events.originalText: William Woods Holden, Governor of North Carolina, became the first U.S. state governor to be removed from office through impeachment.
events.subtitle: William Woods Holden
events.headline: Governor William Woods Holden removed from office through impeachment

events.originalText: The Emerald Buddha (pictured), considered to be the sacred palladium of Thailand, was installed in its current location at Wat Phra Kaew on the grounds of the Grand Palace in Bangkok.
events.subtitle: Emerald Buddha
events.headline: Emerald Buddha installed at Wat Phra Kaew in Bangkok

events.originalText: The Parliament of Great Britain passed the Stamp Act, requiring that many printed materials in the Thirteen Colonies in British America carry a tax stamp.
events.subtitle: Parliament of Great Britain
events.headline: Parliament of Great Britain passes Stamp Act in Thirteen Colonies

events.originalText: Anne Hutchinson was expelled from the Massachusetts Bay Colony for her participation in the Antinomian Controversy.
events.subtitle: Anne Hutchinson
events.headline: Anne Hutchinson expelled from Massachusetts Bay Colony

events.originalText: Pope Clement V issued a bull dissolving the Order of the Knights Templar.
events.subtitle: Pope Clement V
events.headline: Pope Clement V dissolves Order of the Knights Templar

events.originalText: The Bostran era, the official era of the Roman province of Arabia Petraea, began.
events.subtitle: AD 106
events.headline: Bostran era begins in Roman province of Arabia Petraea
